Definition: Column or row headers from each csv file in the dataset.
Type of data (numeric; text; date; time; datetime).
Description of the information in a given column or row in the dataset.
The average basin evapotranspiration (ET).
The F-statistic for the line of best fit for area burned and the response variable.
A brief description of the files in the data package.
Name of files in the data package.
File path within the data package.
The average depth of water contributing to streamflow from shallow groundwater flow (GWQ).
The average percentage of water contributing to streamflow from shallow groundwater flow (GWQ).
The average depth of water contributing to streamflow from lateral flow (LATQ).
The average percentage of water contributing to streamflow from lateral flow (LATQ).

Cells with missing data are represented with a missing value code rather than an empty cell. This column describes which missing value codes were used. The recommendation for numeric data is "-9999" and for character data is "N/A".
The average annual precipitation across the basin.
The average depth of water contributing to streamflow from surface flow (SURQ).
The average percentage of water contributing to streamflow from surface flow (SURQ).
ESS-DIVE Reporting Format or other standard applied to the data file.
Unit of measurement that applies to a given column or row in the data package.
Average annual dissolved organic carbon (DOC) concentration.
Average annual nitrate concentration.
The name of the test basin: humid or semi-arid.
The value of the first coefficient value in the line of best fit for area burned and the response variable.
The value of the second coefficient value in the line of best fit for area burned and the response variable.
The value of the third coefficient value in the line of best fit for area burned and the response variable.
The type of parameter change used for the parameter.
The description of the meaning of the parameter within the model.
The annual load of dissolved organic carbon (DOC).
The equation for the line of best fit for area burned and the response variable.
The Soil and Water Assessment Tool (SWAT) file type the parameter is located in.
The annual streamflow at the basin outlet.
The calibrated parameter values for the humid; primarily forested basin.
The value of the intercept value in the line of best fit for area burned and the response variable.
Either "all" if it applies to all landuses within the model or the Soil and Water Assessment Tool (SWAT) landuse code for the applicable landuse.

The maximum value, which varies by file. Refer to the file name for details on what the value represents (e.g., flow_mm_yr_abs_change indicates the maximum absolute change in flow, measured in millimeters per year).
The maximum value for the high severity scenario.
The maximum value for the low severity scenario.
The maximum value for the moderate severity scenario.
The name of the measurement(s) used to describe the test basins.

The minimum value, which varies by file. Refer to the file name for details on what the value represents (e.g., flow_mm_yr_abs_change indicates the minimum absolute change in flow, measured in millimeters per year).
The minimum value for the high severity scenario.
The minimum value for the low severity scenario.
The minimum value for the moderate severity scenario.
The model used for the line of best fit for area burned and the response variable. See manuscript for more details on model formulas.
The Soil and Water Assessment Tool (SWAT) parameter name.
The annual load of nitrate.
The p-value for the line of best fit for area burned and the response variable.
The path water takes to generate streamflow: surface; lateral; shallow groundwater; deep groundwater.
The average annual precipitation across the basin.
The 5th quantile of dissolved organic carbon (DOC) concentrations.
The 5th quantile of nitrate concentrations.
The 25th quantile of dissolved organic carbon (DOC) concentrations.
The 25th quantile of nitrate concentrations.
The median of dissolved organic carbon (DOC) concentrations.
The median of nitrate concentrations.
The 75th quantile of dissolved organic carbon (DOC) concentrations.
The 75th quantile of nitrate concentrations.
The 95th quantile of dissolved organic carbon (DOC) concentrations.
The 95th quantile of nitrate concentrations.
The r-squared value for the line of best fit for area burned and the response variable.
The area burned scenario given as "PER_*" where the * is the percentage burned in the scenario.
The standard deviation of dissolved organic carbon (DOC) concentrations.
The standard deviation of nitrate concentrations.
The calibrated parameter values for the semi-arid; mixed landuse basin.
The burn severity level (low; moderate; high).
The percentage of area burn required to cross the threshold of unburned variability. See manuscript for more details on how this was derived.
The year the precipitation records came from.
